(43) 93.March 17, 1943.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND key it is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document war CABINET.USE OF THE WOLDS AREA FOR THE TRAINING OF armoured divisions.Note by the Lord President of the Council.AT their meeting on the 1st March, 1943 (W.M. (43) 36th conclusions,Minute 5), the War Cabinet invited me to consider the issues raised in the memoranda by the Secretary of State for War and the Minister of Agriculture,and Fisheries (W.P. (43) 80 and 77) and to decide whether the area of the yorkshire Wolds referred to therein should be taken over by the War Office asa training area for armoured formations or whether alternative means couldbe found of satisfying the essential needs of the Army with less damage to agricultural production.2. After a thorough enquiry, I have satisfied myself that no alternative means can be found of meeting the essential needs of the Army with less damage to agricultural production. I have accordingly decided that the area in question should be taken over by the War Office as a training area for armoured forma-tions. The necessary measures are being taken to this end.J. A.Privy Council Office,Great George Street, S.W. 1.March 17, 1943.[25172]Printed for the War Cabinet.- March 1943.
